summary: three vehicles collided on brisbane valley highway on wednesday afternoon . three vehicles were taken to ipswich hospital in brisbane . the three were involved in a crash crash in brisbane , brisbane . three people were including four children , have been taken to hospital with minor injuries . three car pileup happened at the brisbane valley west of fernvale . a 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy suffered from abdominal pain . the two were airlifted to hospital and airlifted a number of patients to hospital .

aspect: - Ten people, including four children, were involved in a multi-vehicle crash in Brisbane's west.
- Three vehicles collided on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, on Wednesday afternoon.
- A 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy with chest pain were the first patients flown out by rescue helicopter.
- They've been taken to the Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane.
- A 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl suffering from abdominal pain were also being flown out.
- Six others, including an infant and two young girls, have been taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment.
- A man has also suffered hand lacerations and two females escaped injuries.
- The affected stretch of the highway has been closed off, with diversions in place south of Fernvale.
- Police said the highway would be closed for a few hours with diversions in place south of Fernvale.
- The Courier-Mail reports that earlier emergency crews found one person trapped inside their vehicle and Queensland Fire and Rescue crews used hydraulic cutting gear to free them.
- The Rescue 500 helicopter then landed at the scene and airlifted a number of patients to hospital.
explain:
Ten people, including four children, were involved in a multi-vehicle crash in Brisbane's west. 

The core idea of this aspect is that a crash involved ten people, including four children, in Brisbane's west.
A core idea of this aspect is that three vehicles crashed on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2 km south of Fernvale, on Wednesday afternoon.

The given aspect highlights that among the three patients who were airlifted to hospital following the three car pileup at the brisbane valley highway, a 40-year-old man and a five-year-old boy were the first to be rescued by the rescue helicopter. The 40-year-old man sustained chest and shoulder injuries and the five-year-old boy suffered from chest pain. Their critical condition required immediate medical attention and they were quickly airlifted to hospital for further treatment.
The aspect states that three people including four children were taken to Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane following a three-vehicle crash on Brisbane Valley Highway.

The aspect highlights that a 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl suffering from abdominal pain were also being flown out alongside the 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy suffering from abdominal pain. All three victims were airlifted to hospital as their conditions were severe.

The aspect states that six individuals including an infant and two young girls were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. This suggests that along with the two individuals who were airlifted to the hospital, there were six others who also sustained minor injuries or needed further assessment.

The aspect adds more information about the injuries sustained by the people involved in the accident. It mentions that besides the two people who were airlifted to hospital, another man suffered hand lacerations and two females escaped injuries. This provides a broader picture of the severity of the injuries caused by the accident and the impact on different people involved.

The aspect highlights the closure of the affected stretch of the highway due to the three-vehicle collision. Diversions have been established south of Fernvale to accommodate the closure and redirect traffic.
The given aspect from the text is that the road would stay closed for several hours, with diversions set up for vehicles traveling south of Fernvale due to the accident.
The aspect highlights that emergency crews found one person trapped inside their vehicle and used hydraulic cutting gear to free them.

According to the given aspect, after the three vehicles collided on Brisbane Valley Highway on Wednesday afternoon, the Rescue 500 helicopter was called in to airlift a number of patients to hospital. Specifically, the helicopter landed at the scene and airlifted the 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and the five-year-old boy who was suffering from abdominal pain.
